summary: There's a Crack in the Rear View Mirror and a Bend in the Road Ahead - Chapter 1 - Grimalkin - Critical Role (Web Series)...
title: There's a Crack in the Rear View Mirror and a Bend in the Road Ahead - Chapter 1 - Grimalkin - Critical Role (Web Series) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Rating:
Teen And Up Audiences
Archive Warning:
No Archive Warnings Apply
Category:
M/M
Fandom:
Critical Role (Web Series)

Characters:
Caleb Widogast, Jester (Critical Role), Beauregard (Critical Role), Nott (Critical Role), Fjord (Critical Role), Caduceus Clay, Yasha (Critical Role)
Additional Tags:
Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Crack Treated Seriously, Autistic Caleb Widogast, Mental Health Issues, Dissociation,Other Additional Tags to Be Added

Summary:The Beacon was an incredible artifact of unknowable power that none of the Mighty Nein truly understood. Of it’s many uses, some of it’s functions include: Defying fate, Undoing time, Winning drinking contests, and as Caleb has most recently discovered, catapulting a group of hapless assholes across all of probable reality to a world where industry and technology have taken the place of magic.
In which Jester finds the joy in the situation, alternate reality Beau’s life unravels at the seams, and Caleb hates the hustle and bustle.

Now if they could find the rest of the Mighty Nein, the Beacon that sent them here in the first place, and a way back home, that would be great.

blog.name: moonwhing
blog.title: Basically Evil in Assorted Shades
blog.description: Tip me on ko-fi! Where Moon sheepishly shoves her creations out into the world and hopes for the best. Hi! I'm Morwenna. This was supposed to be an art blog, but it quickly turned into my personal blog and now you’ll find a little bit of everything around here. I’m an artist that spends her days drawing, crocheting, and sometimes posing her figurines for funny little stories. Find my work on Redbubble, Society6, and Teepublic! Would you like a crocheted doll? Contact me for a quote!

tags: ive never actually watched taz whoops
body:
D&D Rookie Help!

So I’m thinking of joining a d&d campaign soon and I’m really excited but also have never played before? So I’d really appreciate some tips 😊

-Where should I get dice, and what kind (material, amount, etc)?

-I have some characters already created, but are there any races/classes that are specifically good for beginners?

-Any general advice?

If you could help me understand a bit more, I’d really appreciate it!

summary: So unfortunately, it doesn’t look like Ashley is going to be doing anything for Critical Role at New York Comic Con this year,...
body:
So unfortunately, it doesn’t look like Ashley is going to be doing anything for Critical Role at New York Comic Con this year, which is a bit of a bummer but I figured everyone who was going to see the CR crew ought to know.

(However, she didn’t mention anything about Critical Role Live, so maybe there’s a chance she’ll be there?)

reblog.comment:
So unfortunately, it doesn’t look like Ashley is going to be doing anything for Critical Role at New York Comic Con this year, which is a bit of a bummer but I figured everyone who was going to see the CR crew ought to know.

(However, she didn’t mention anything about Critical Role Live, so maybe there’s a chance she’ll be there?)

trail.content:
So unfortunately, it doesn’t look like Ashley is going to be doing anything for Critical Role at New York Comic Con this year, which is a bit of a bummer but I figured everyone who was going to see the CR crew ought to know.

(However, she didn’t mention anything about Critical Role Live, so maybe there’s a chance she’ll be there?)

summary:
Watchmaster Bryce
Photography: (IG and Twitter) Breaktheblondie
Bryce: (IG) CJ.Starry (Twitter) CJStarry
Series: c2 Critical...
body:
Watchmaster Bryce

Photography: (IG and Twitter) Breaktheblondie

Bryce: (IG) CJ.Starry (Twitter) CJStarry

Series: c2 Critical Role

Thank you to breaktheblondie for these beautiful photos from the Dragoncon2018 CritRole Meetup!

And thank you to Matt Mercer and the entire CriticalRole gang for creating such a wonderful, inspiring, enthralling, inclusive world. I cannot express how important it has been to me to see representation done with care and compassion. Thank you, CR, for all you do.

I love you.
